newsitem.title: MEXICO: Mexico's Pemex details June production, exports.
newsitem.headline: Mexico's Pemex details June production, exports.

text.p: Mexico's state owned oil and gas monopoly Petroleos Mexicanos (Pemex) said on Tuesday its average crude output for June was 3.007 million barrels per day (bpd) compared to 2.880 million bpd in the year ago period.
Pemex said average natural gas production for the period was 4.412 billion cubic feet per day (cfd), compared with 4.335 billion cfd in June 1996.
Pemex said its June natural gas exports were 44.6 million cfd versus 18.9 million a year ago, and its imports fell to 81 million cfd from 96.2 million.
Average crude output in the second quarter rose to 2.981 million bpd, up from 2.869 million the same month a year ago.
Natural gas output in the quarter averaged 4.411 billion cfd, up from 4.316 billion.
Pemex said the increase in crude production failed to offset the fall in prices, as the average price tag on the Mexican basket of crude fell $2.13 from June 1996 to $15.83 per barrel.
"According to the Q2 report, in the quarter the increase in (crude) production did not compensate fully for the fall in prices," Pemex said.
